alert.note: Alert for Barnes; Cass; Ransom; Richland; Sargent (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 20 at 5:35AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER IMPACTS EXPECTED THIS WEEK... Multiple winter weather systems are expected to impact the region this week. See the latest hazard statements regarding the ongoing winter travel hazards with the clipper and arctic front today and tonight. Another period of accumulating snow is expected mainly along and south of Interstate 94 in southeast North Dakota Tuesday afternoon into Tuesday evening as a larger storm system develops to the west. This could bring minor to moderate winter travel impacts due to accumulating snowfall of 2 inches or more. Winds may not be as much of an issue during this period of snowfall lowering probability for blowing snow. The larger storm system will directly impact the region starting Wednesday morning through Thursday evening. This system will bring a greater chance for heavy snow accumulations and blowing snow across the southern Red River Valley along with increasing winds and blowing snow. The probability for warning impacts is 50 to 80% with that system along and south of Interstate 94, including the potential for blizzard conditions. The best chance for warning impacts will be closer to the South Dakota border. Further north near blizzard conditions and lighter snow accumulations will be possible, but the probability for warning impacts are less than 20%. Please monitor weather.gov/fgf for the latest forecasts regarding these potential winter weather impacts.
